homes_hear_details: New York has launched its HOMES and HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. NYSERDA (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority) is administering the programs, building on its existing robust energy efficiency infrastructure and EmPower+ program to deliver rebates for whole-home energy efficiency and high-efficiency electric equipment.
state_energy_office: New York State Energy Research and Development Authority (NYSERDA)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For New York, 80% of Area Median Income varies significantly by county. In New York City (all five boroughs), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $90,850. Upstate in Monroe County (Rochester), it is approximately $63,900.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For New York, 150% of Area Median Income varies significantly by county. In New York City, 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $170,350. In Monroe County (Rochester), it is approximately $119,800.

net_metering: New York transitioned from traditional net metering to the Value of Distributed Energy Resources (VDER) or Value Stack compensation for new solar installations. Under VDER, solar customers are compensated based on when and where they generate energy, including energy value, capacity value, environmental value, and demand reduction value. Legacy net metering customers retain retail-rate credits.

state_tax_credits.name: New York State Solar Energy System Equipment Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 25% of the cost of a solar energy system, up to $5,000
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems installed on residential property
state_tax_credits.details: New York offers a personal income tax credit for the purchase and installation of solar energy system equipment for residential use.

state_tax_credits.name: New York State Real Property Tax Exemption for Solar and Wind
state_tax_credits.amount: 15-year exemption from any increase in property tax due to the installation of a solar or wind energy system
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems, solar thermal systems, wind energy systems
state_tax_credits.details: Municipalities in New York may opt into this exemption. Most municipalities have adopted it, though some may opt out or impose a different exemption level.

state_rebate_programs.name: NYSERDA EmPower+ Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $10,000+ in no-cost home energy improvements for income-qualifying households; reduced-cost improvements for moderate-income
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system replacement, heat pumps, health and safety measures
state_rebate_programs.details: EmPower+ combines the former EmPower New York and Assisted Home Performance programs. Provides free or reduced-cost energy efficiency improvements based on income level.

state_rebate_programs.name: NY-Sun Residential Solar Incentive
state_rebate_programs.amount: Per-watt incentive varying by utility territory and income; typically $0.20-$0.40/watt for market rate, higher for LMI
state_rebate_programs.details: NY-Sun provides upfront incentives to reduce the cost of solar installation. Enhanced incentives are available for low-to-moderate income households and affordable housing.

state_rebate_programs.name: Residential Clean Heating and Cooling Incentives
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $1,000-$15,000+ per home depending on system type and income
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air-source heat pumps, ground-source heat pumps, heat pump water heaters
state_rebate_programs.details: NYSERDA provides incentives for the installation of clean heating and cooling systems as part of New York's Climate Act goals. Higher incentives are available for income-qualifying households.

programs.name: Con Edison Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,000 for heat pumps, $300 for smart thermostats, $500 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, smart thermostats, insulation, ENERGY STAR appliances, EV chargers

programs.name: Con Edison Marketplace
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostats, LED lighting, smart power strips, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: National Grid Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $1,000 for high-efficiency heating, $300 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency boilers, furnaces, heat pumps, insulation, smart thermostats, water heaters

programs.name: PSEG LI Home Comfort Program
programs.amount: Up to $1,500 for heat pumps, up to $1,000 for other HVAC
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, central air conditioning, insulation, duct sealing

programs.name: PSEG LI Home Energy Assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation with direct-install measures including LEDs and smart power strips
